title: How to Make Tumbet

steps.headline: Prepare the fresh tomatoes.
steps.description: Place in hot water for a minute, then peel off the skin. Remove the seeds and chop finely.

steps.headline: Prepare the capsicums/bell peppers.
steps.description: Core them, then remove the seeds. Cut into thin strips.

steps.headline: Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a frying pan over low heat.
steps.description: Add the garlic slices and cook for 1 minute.

steps.headline: Pour in the canned tomatoes and add the fresh tomatoes.
steps.description: Add the oregano. Mix all through. Simmer the sauce for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a small frying pan over low heat. Add the potato slices and cook until both sides are golden.

steps.headline: Arrange the cooked potato slices on the baking dish.
Add the eggplant slices to the same frying pan but increase the heat to medium–high.
steps.description: Fry for 1–2 minutes in the same oil. When both sides of the slices are browned, remove them and place on paper towel to drain.

steps.headline: Arrange the drained eggplant slices on top of the fried potato slices.
Add new oil to the frying pan.
steps.description: Fry the capsicum/bell pepper slices for 2–3 minutes. Once cooked, add these to the top of the eggplant slices.

steps.headline: Using a spoon, add the tomato sauce over the vegetable layers.
Place in the oven to bake.
steps.description: Bake for 20 minutes, or until hot and bubbling.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and serve immediately.
steps.description: It is a good idea to add a drizzle of fresh olive oil prior to serving. This is best placed on the table for diners to serve themselves from.

text: Prepare the fresh tomatoes. Place in hot water for a minute, then peel off the skin. Remove the seeds and chop finely. Prepare the capsicums/bell peppers. Core them, then remove the seeds. Cut into thin strips. Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a frying pan over low heat. Add the garlic slices and cook for 1 minute. Pour in the canned tomatoes and add the fresh tomatoes. Add the oregano. Mix all through. Simmer the sauce for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a small frying pan over low heat. Add the potato slices and cook until both sides are golden. Arrange the cooked potato slices on the baking dish.  Add the eggplant slices to the same frying pan but increase the heat to medium–high. Fry for 1–2 minutes in the same oil. When both sides of the slices are browned, remove them and place on paper towel to drain. Arrange the drained eggplant slices on top of the fried potato slices.  Add new oil to the frying pan. Fry the capsicum/bell pepper slices for 2–3 minutes. Once cooked, add these to the top of the eggplant slices. Using a spoon, add the tomato sauce over the vegetable layers. Cover completely and evenly. Place in the oven to bake. Bake for 20 minutes, or until hot and bubbling. Remove from the oven and serve immediately. It is a good idea to add a drizzle of fresh olive oil prior to serving. This is best placed on the table for diners to serve themselves from.
